a:r.a:t: No
Scope
Scope Description
Assumptions and Deliverables
NPO Portal Design
Prepare wireframes of the following pages for the NPO portal
Login
New request
My request
Public national registry
PwC will provide 1 design option for the portal and will be based on the existing Social Welfare portal design which is already TDRA complaint
Portal design will go through up to 2 revisions after which portal design will be considered as accepted
Portal design will be provided in English and Arabic (up to 5 pages).
Portal design will be provided for web browser in 1 resolution only
Same portal design will be used for all three personas i.e. NPOs, public users and local entities
NPO and local entity users will use the existing UAE Pass / EID based authentication mechanism only
PwC has estimated up to 40 man days for the design of the portal
MoCD team will be responsible for providing UI and brand guidelines including any assets such as static content, icons, colors that needs to be used
Deliverables
NPO portal design
Implementation of NPO Portal
Build a customer facing portal using Angular or React framework
Configure authentication on the portal for external users and local entities using UAE Pass or Emirates ID
Configure following pages on the portal
Login
New request
My request
Public national registry screen
Approved NPO Registry
Configure 13 services on portal based on the deployment plan and complexity:
Drop 1:
Licensing and Declaration - Large
Request to close the NPO - Medium
Fundraising Request - Small
General Assembly Meeting Request - Small
Appeal on licensing and declaration rejection - Small
Request to attend events - Small
Drop 2:
Non-Muslim Worship Places Processes - Large
Request to increase budget - Medium
Request for Amending the policy and regulation - Small
Support Service - Small
Request to organise events - Small
Request to join or work with other global organization - Small
Request to open branches and offices - Small
During the discovery phase the deployment plan and complexity of each of the 13 services might be revised
13 NPO related services with up to 15 pages will be available on the portal
Changes required on the MoCD website to deploy the portal will be managed by MoCD
Portal will be configured in English and Arabic languages. Translation between English and Arabic will be validated by MoCD during the first week of the Implementation phase
PwC will not build the portal to cater for any specific resolution or device.
Documents submitted through the portal will be stored on SharePoint
Data presented on the Portal will be based on the information available in MS Dynamics
The portal will be will be compatible with web browsers only in 1 resolution and doesn’t support mobile responsiveness
PwC has estimated up to 160 man days of development for the implementation of the portal across the two drops
MoCD will provide the required Web APIs to integrate with ICP and UAE Pass
MoCD will be responsible for procuring the required software and hardware licenses for the software
Phase 2 Implementation Scope
PwC Digital | Confidential
